intro: Spirostachys synandra, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that appear in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
